Reviews.Title: “fun place”
Reviews.Author: Dan K
Reviews.Content: clean friendly nice staff. You feel like you are living in the 1930s (in a good way).

Reviews.Title: “Decent hotel with friendly staff”
Reviews.Author: Whitney S
Reviews.Content: We travelled as a group of five and were able to share one room. The staff were very friendly and helpful... when you can find them (and they leave the hotel in the evening). Room was clean, spacious and warm, however we did have some issues with one of the cots, but they repaired it quickly. Room was cleaned every day. Breakfast in the morning was just fine. Hotel was very quiet. It is just off a very posh shopping street, so places to eat were few and far between. However, it is very close to a couple public transport stops.

Reviews.Title: “Enjoyed it!!”
Reviews.Author: gf1349
Reviews.Content: My wife, son and I spend three night at the Funk in late November. I was ideal for us. It is as well located as any hotel in the city and the staff were more than helpful. Our flight arrived late and they made arrangements for our key to be left at a nearby restaurant and could not have been more helpful. Also, the breakfast was terrific.

Reviews.Title: “Everything I needed plus excellent service”
Reviews.Author: Kellie K
Reviews.Content: Hotel Pension Funk welcomed me to Berlin for a brief business trip. HPF offered me a quiet, restful place in which to sleep, charming decor, reliable WIFI, convenient location for the purpose of my trip and a healthful breakfast. During the space between the end of my business meetings and the flight, the staff gave me a quiet place to work and use of their internet service even after I had checked out. I will stay again on my next trip to Berlin!

Reviews.Title: “I highly recommend Pension Funk”
Reviews.Author: SuzePi
Reviews.Content: I traveled with Sue P and another friend and couldn't agree more with what Sue P has written. I would add that we each had our own bathrooms, too. There are rooms that share so you have choices. Free WiFi was present and that was a benefit. No TVs, no radio but that was fine for all of us. I would certain go back and recommend it to friends. Susan in Seattle

Reviews.Title: “Reasonably priced, nice rooms, good staff, close to services”
Reviews.Author: JaiDeeHawk
Reviews.Content: I enjoyed my stay here. My room was spacious and comfortable, it felt more like staying in a stately home than a hotel. The staff were knowledgeable, helpful and accommodation. The quality of breakfast is equivalent to much more expensive places I have stayed in. The area is well serviced and interesting. All-in-all, excellent value.

Reviews.Title: “A Jewel”
Reviews.Author: Sue P
Reviews.Content: This is a charming hotel in a location with many amenities within walking distance to lots of great shops and restaurants, and a block to the U-Bahn, a few blocks walk to the Banhof-Zoo station, and right on the route to the "hop on hop off" tour bus on Ku'damm. I was there with 2 friends and we each had a single room with bathroom ensuite. The rooms are very small but what more do you need if you are out all day touring and are only there to sleep? Breakfast buffet is wonderful, staff are really accommodating and want to ensure that you have a good stay. High recommendation from me! Sue in Seattle

Reviews.Title: “Wunderbar! A monument to survival.”
Reviews.Author: GAIL T
Reviews.Content: In German, "funk" = radio, but the English connotation of funky sort of suits it, too. The Pension Funk is in a wonderful old residential building, off a quiet side street, just off the Kurfurstendamm. It once was the home of a Danish silent movie star (Asta Nielsen) and I wish the old walls could talk. Its charm can be discovered in its details, occasional glimpses of threadbare qualities, and its very survival for, as any reader of history knows, Berlin was blown to bits at the conclusion of the war. I loved the ability to come and go without fanfare, the breakfasts in the old dining room, the very Northern European furnishings, and the proximity to so many wonderful shops and sights. My companion thought it too threadbare for his taste but I loved it and would go back in a heart beat and feel I was back in the arms of an old friend.

Reviews.Title: “Charm in abundance”
Reviews.Author: CanWith
Reviews.Content: This is not a place for those who set comfort high. There are no TVs in the rooms and the hotel being in an old building, most of the ensuite bathrooms have a DIY feel. This is a place if you set personal and friendly service, flair, ambiente and charm above all and don't mind quirky. The breakfast buffet is fantastic. Great value for money!

Reviews.Title: “ENJOYED IT AND RETURNING AGAIN”
Reviews.Author: YVONNE E
Reviews.Content: Just wanted to add my voice. We loved this hotel, the quaintness and remaining true to the period. Room overlooking courtyard was good, bed very comfortable, breakfast fine. After being robbed in Paris immediately we arrived, this was an oasis. Unfortunately we lost a day with reporting loss etc and I have always regretted we only had one night in Berlin, so we are returning next month. We will most certainly stay in teh Pension Funk, even though we can afford a 4 star hotel. Loved the hotel and its charm, the quiet location in Charlottenberg, access to the FuDam, and the Literaturhaus over the road. Much more to see and Pension Funk will definitely be our base.

Reviews.Title: “Hidden Charm”
Reviews.Author: backhanding
Reviews.Content: Beautiful, charming, original, non-fussy, great value. These characteristics outweigh the occasional inconvenience of the Pension access/ communication issues.

Reviews.Title: “Great location - could need an brush up in the rooms”
Reviews.Author: MortenOlesen
Reviews.Content: We stayed for four nights in two different rooms and they are much alike even though the interior is different in all rooms. It's spacious, it old and a bit worn down, the beds are ok except for one that was so soft that you got the feeling that you were being swallowed by the bed. It's a hotel with atmosphere and you cannot really compare to the big hotel chains such as Hilton, Raddisson etc - if you do you are going to be disappointed. It's more like you've rented a room, it's almost :-/ clean, you can get your nights sleep and a fair breakfast in the morning and.......best of all, it's very close to KuDamm and the 'Wintergarten im Literaturhaus' and you don't pay a fortune :-). If you arrive on a workday by car it can be difficult to find a parking space close to the hotel! Suggestion to the owners: you should spend some time getting the chairs, beds, tables etc cleaned.

Reviews.Title: “Great place to stay in a great location for a great price.”
Reviews.Author: jplight
Reviews.Content: We found this on a last minute decision and loved everything, from the quirky room, to the friendly staff and fantastic breakfast options.

Reviews.Title: “Charming Belle Epoque family hotel with delicious breakfasts and very helpful staff”
Reviews.Author: TonyPlatt
Reviews.Content: I am a writer from the US, have stayed twice and I plan to return when I am in Berlin again. The rooms are spotless, the beds comfy with feather duvets and pillows, the wood furniture is from the period the hotel was built, and for a little more money you can get a large room with views over the courtyard or street. It is a little frayed, but this is part of its charm. The staff are very helpful. A delicious breakfast is served in a sunny parlor and the staff goes out of their way for the guests. The hotel is centrally located and there are nearby subway, light rail and bus stops. I think that any negative reviews must have come from people who wanted to stay at a more Hilton-like hotel.

Reviews.Title: “A charming, quiet pension in a great location”
Reviews.Author: Letstravel44
Reviews.Content: I chose Pension Funk because I wanted to stay in a place that wasn't like a typical American hotel. There are many of those in Berlin, and Pension Funk represents the opposite. It's decor pays homage to Asta Nielsen, the former resident of this large apartment, who was a 1920's silent film star. While this isn't a fancy hotel, it's old furniture makes it pleasantly homey. I stayed there twice, in different rooms, and both times the bed was comfortable, the hotel quiet, the breakfast plentiful, and the staff very helpful and friendly. The bathrooms are simple but updated. You can't beat the location of a quiet street off the Kurfuerstendamm, near major subway and S-Bahn connections and shopping, and in a district where there are many restaurants. I would definitely stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Nice Visit”
Reviews.Author: CHB_NYC
Reviews.Content: The hotel is in a great location and the staff if very helpful. The rooms and bathrooms are clean and it is a great value for a single traveler. The hotel is very interesting and cozy with a beautiful breakfast room and garden view. The breakfast was excellent.

Reviews.Title: “Moderately funky, minimally comfy”
Reviews.Author: Wanderlieder
Reviews.Content: A heat wave made the room almost unbearable. It's time for the owners to start installing up-to-date windows so that guests can at least get some air without inviting every bug in the neighborhood in for a nibble. With the very old windows wide open for circulation, privacy disappeared. One could see and be seen quite easily. A small room fan would have been a blessing. Breakfast was on the skimpy side. The mattress in my room is overdue for replacement. Bedside lamp didn't work. The key to my room didn't work well, either. My room opened onto a courtyard, but was still noisy. If I recommended this hotel to a friend, it would be solely for its location, a block off KuDamm, and its low price.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic hotel!”
Reviews.Author: antigone726
Reviews.Content: My bf and I stayed there for I think 4 nights. It's a really fantastic hotel, all decorated in Belle époque style (if uneducated people get confused between this and scruffiness then it's there problem!) It's very well located in West Berlin in a really lovely, safe area, lit a minute away from the tube station and 2 min from Kudamm. A few nice restaurants including one just accross the road. Only thing is - do make sure you specified you book for a double bed as we initially ended up in a twin bed (which btw is really small so wouldn't recommend it) and decided to upgrade to a double bed room which was MASSIVE (almost the size of a flat) with nice belle époque furniture. I think we had to share toilets but not shower, either way there were quite a few so we felt like we were the only one using it and it was spotless. The staff is fluent English. Oh and the breakfast is great, a LOT of choice on the buffet so you can stuff your face before exploring the city! To me it remained one of the most fantastic stay I had in a hotel so would defo recommend it, especially for lovers.

Reviews.Title: “Charming!”
Reviews.Author: CocodiCoco
Reviews.Content: Stayed 3 nights in this charming Pension in the centre of Berlin, sharing with friends. The hotel feels like a large gracious apartment from a bygone era. It is utterly charming- the decor is authentic down to the aged telephone and antiques throughout (although thankfully the bathroom was modern, if a bit small). One can feel the history all around and I was reminded of childhood trips to a country manor. The pension is situated up 2 flights of stairs in a townhouse (a word of warning to those unable to manage the steps- there is an elevator too, accessed through a side door and with a key- might be a good idea to inquire before arrival!) Our room (number 22) was huge, and beautifully decorated with original furniture and fittings from Art Nouveau to 1950's. Obviously the furniture showed its age somewhat, but not in a negative way. The ceilings must have been at least 4 metres high. As already mentioned the bathroom was very small, but adequate. A hairdryer was found for us and a needle and thread for a quick repair-job. The beds were very comfortable and the towels were plentiful and changed daily. The staff were extremely nice and left us completely in peace. We were always last to leave the breakfast room, but they still refilled things even after breakfast time and never made us feel we should be moving on. The quality of the breakfast and coffee was also good. Water and beer can be taken from a fridge in the hallway at any time for a moderate price. The location is excellent, it could hardly be more central- yet Fasanen Str so quiet that we slept with open windows without being unduly bothered by street noise. Also the value for money was unbeatable, and included breakfast, wifi and taxes . We really enjoyed our stay and would certainly go back, and I do recommend it. However, be aware that it is not a standardised Hotel à la Hilton or similar, and has quirks and personality. Don't book if you want room service at 4am and a bellboy and flatscreen-TV (in fact there are no televisions at all in the hotel!). Do book if you appreciate an old-world glamour and historic feel and look, spacious rooms, creaky parquet and an air of old Berlin.

Reviews.Title: “Unique German style, very friendly staff, well-located”
Reviews.Author: Lit_Travels
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed at this hostel for 2 nights. The staff was very friendly throughout our stay. It has the feel of a large home, with winding hallways and high ceilings. Our room was down several halls, which provided us much privacy (I think it was room 29). It was quiet, although that may have been because of when we traveled. Our room was clean and well-provided, with an en suite bathroom. The breakfast was fine, and very comparable to most of the others we had during our stay in German. I found everything was prepared effectively, and they brought out either tea or coffee to each individual guest. The pension is very well located, close to mass transit and several restaurants and shopping. Overall, the pension has the charm of an B&B in an older home, filled with mismatched furniture and older furnishings that give it charm. Yet it was clean and felt safe. It had a lived in feel, which made it much more appealing than the austere, sanitized feel you can get in international hotels. I felt like I was closer to Germany culture in this pension. We would definitely visit this pension again if we return to Berlin.

Reviews.Title: “A little treasure!”
Reviews.Author: Diti
Reviews.Content: Just back from a week end in Berlin . Stayed at the Pension Funk. Old fashioned, friendly, quaint and very cosy. Friendly reception, lovely breakfast, comfortable rooms with down quilts, recently renovated bathroom but most important the location is superb. Right beside an underground and the Ku-damm.This lovely guesthouse is situated on the Fasanenstrasse. A very upmarket street with beautiful buildings, boutiques and art galleries. The famous Kathe Kollowitz museum is right across the street. A real treasure! Diti from Dublin

Reviews.Title: “Historic and comfortable”
Reviews.Author: Travel2008Arizona
Reviews.Content: We were delighted with this historic hotel off the Ku'Damm Strasse. It was older but nicely maintained and we found the staff to be friendly and helpful. The breakfast was one of the highlights of our week long trip to Germany. The meats and cheeses were delicious, the coffee hot and strong, with fresh cream, and the broetchen were divine. The soft boiled eggs were new for us, but we enjoyed them immensely. The rooms were large with comfortable down bedding, and ceiling high windows. Books, magazines and other papers from all over the world were available to borrow in the "lobby". If you want a cookie-cutter hotel in such a historic place as Berlin, this is not the place for you. I've never been any place like it and I would not have traded our three nights in Berlin for any other hotel. It was not that expensive, and the location could not be beat.

Reviews.Title: “Unpleasant and pricy”
Reviews.Author: shusaku
Reviews.Content: Unpleasant and Unfriendly. Worst place I have ever stayed. The walls were paper-thin. I could hear every single sound in the whole entire hotel on day and night. Although a breakfast was ok, boiled eggs were completely undercooked. When we told the staff about it, they just signed at us and ignored our comment on it. While we were still eating a breakfast, the staff switched off all the light in the breakfast room! I was completely shocked by their rudeness! So impolite, so unfriendly. The room price was expensive. When I was taking a walk, I found more nicer hotel with cheaper price. Not recommended to stay here at all.

Reviews.Title: “Historic Pension with great location”
Reviews.Author: 1globetrotterSweden
Reviews.Content: Stayed at Pension Funk in Berlin for four nights in december 2007 and found in historic and with a great location at Fasanenstrasse. It is a old Pension so don't expect to much. It has a great feeling to it. Friendly Staff and great breakfast.

Reviews.Title: “Words Fail Me-almost”
Reviews.Author: STAGETRAVELLER
Reviews.Content: I stayed in this dump with a party of six for several nights as it had been booked by our company-had it not been for this I would have turned round and left on arrival. One arrives on the ground floor into a grubby smelly lobby,poorly lit to be faced with a vicious flight of grubby marble stairs partly coverd by worn and tatty linoleum.At the top of this flight of stairs there is an ancient lift that one needs a key for and as there is often no staff present there is no way of getting this key.The alternative is yet another flight of even more dimly lit wooden stars coverd by a worn ,dirty cord carpet with dangerous holes in it which could catch a heel and cause a serious fall. The entrace door to the hotel on the second floor is grubby and a stale smell pervades. On entry to the hotel through a scruffy unpolished door there is a long narrow hallway with a grubby carpet covered over by various assorted mats and runners. My room which had a sink and free standing shower cubicle in it had no toilet. Under the shower cubicle was a patch of unevenly cut grubby linoleum laid on top of a badly worn and long neglected parquet floor.The walls were covered by wall paper, I would estimate about 30 /40 years old and not the best then! Skirting boards all round the room were literally filthy with built up varnish and possibly polish from some past attempt at housekeeping and considerable amounts of dust in corners.Woodwork was all cream ,chipped and dirty especially the window.The curtains,unlined, and of the variety found at jumble sales many years ago, hung from old ,noisy and sticky curtain rails and a ghastly pelmet. A standard lamp with a dirty shade with its trim hanging off did little to pierce the gloom. Two arm chairs in grubby pink draylon with bits of the upholstery hanging off and a selection of non matching dark and badly treated furniture completed the image. Bedding was clean and of white cotton but was never changed in 9 nights! Towels ,white, and replaced daily were a little tired but adequate. Apart from liquid soap at the sink no complimentary toiletries provided or even a box of tissues. As one had to cross the hall to get to a toilet it might have been nice to have a robe provided but this would be too much to expect from this establishment. No TV /radio/clock or free internet connection. As floors creaked and noise insulation is poor one is aware of,and woken up at all hours by ,other guests coming and going noise from adjacent rooms and the office telephone ringing. Breakfast was unimaginative and basic with no fresh fruit juice and no hot food apart from boiled eggs -someimes soft sometimes hard at luke warm temperature. An indescribable jug of brown luke warm liquid is called coffee. A tatty display about the silent movie actress Asta Neilsen does nothing to justify this establishment trading on this tenuous claim to fame. Incidentaly she only lived in part of the current hotel and apparently only for about 18 months in the 1930s. It feels as if the whole place has received little care and attention since then. There is quaint, bijou ,characterful and well kept , loved and polished and then there is tired,unloved and frankly knackered and this excuse of a hotel falls into the latter category. It is obvious that the place is busy with good occupancy rates and that much is being taken out by the owners but that very little has been put back in for a very long time.Never again!

Reviews.Title: “Will be back again soon to Pension Funk,”
Reviews.Author: maddogs3
Reviews.Content: Myself, my husband (both mid 40's) and my friends (both mid 40's) and the husband on crutches due to a broken ankle were thrilled witht he location. After reading reviews just before we arrived I was put off, but was delighted to experience a completly different attitude, we received a key to the service lift immediatly they saw the crutches and let us hold onto it for 4 days. The rooms were so clean and spacious it was great, the breakfasts were excellent and set us up for the day, we did not have to rush away and could sit and chat and keep topping up our plates and cups for as long as we wanted. The staff were kept to themselves and did not intrude on us at all except to offer help and advice when we asked them. We had a very early flight on the morning we were leaving and they left us a packed lunch in the fridge and a flask of coffee to drink before we left. Now how Irish is that!!!!! We will be back, the location is excellent and very very safe.

Reviews.Title: “Loved it, old world charm”
Reviews.Author: Lenzatti
Reviews.Content: My wife stayed at the Pension Funk in Berlin in September 2006 and loved it. The Pension Funk is a villa that once belonged to a silent movie actress. It has retained its old world charm and still feels like a private home. The only criticism my wife has was that no one pointed out to her the service elevator and she was left to carry up her luggage two flights of stairs to her room on her own. But the flair of the place, its location, and the price are all very good.

Reviews.Title: “Scary, truly scary”
Reviews.Author: Tootje
Reviews.Content: You walk into an old building, then you have to drag your suitcases up three flights of stairs because the owner does not let the elevator come down (this was a 3pm too!). You walk into an dirty, old hallway and speak to a rude man that sits in the closet. The place smells like old moth balls and you just know people have died here. The hallways are creepy and the entire feel of the hotel is scarey. We needed a couple bottles of wine just to fall asleep. It is the worst hotel I have ever stayed at in my life.

Reviews.Title: “No electricity one night and no overnight on-site management”
Reviews.Author: GabKat
Reviews.Content: We booked the room (highest price-private bath) half a year ago. When we arrived dead-tired from our flight from the US (my sister travelled from California & I from New York) our room was not available. We had to climb two flights with our luggage. We were given a small room with two beds and private bath. The stall shower was the size of a broom closet -- not designed for the stout or for anyone desiring to was his/her feet. After check-in, we were given a key for the elevator which would have been useful for getting our luggage up to the vestibule. There are no arrangements for getting the key from the street level and their is no intercom to signal for help. Breakfast was very good and staff very accomodating and friendly. Beds fairly comfortable -- down comforters and pillows. No TV, radio, etc. Everything is neat and clean. After two days, we were given a different room in another wing of the pension. This room was an improvement, not in size but because it had a separate WC and shower arrangement. We arrived back after a day of sightseeing and dinner at 10:45 PM one night to discover that the entire section where I second room was was plunged into darkness. I had a flashlight with me -- we were able to find our way back to the main vestibule and copy down emergency numbers. We were able to call these numbers and leave messages only. We made five calls and left as many messages. Finally, after more than an hour of frustration, we got through to a live human being. We went to sleep and in the middle of the morning, the ceiling light came on. The other lights in the room were repaired the next day. This old pension (1895) came highly recommended. I will not stay there the next time I go to Berlin, but will find another place in the same great location (near the KuDamm, the Bristol Kempinski Hotel, Ulandstrasse U-Bahn & bus stop).

Reviews.Title: “warning for older travellers”
Reviews.Author: travelling_granny
Reviews.Content: This is a charming place, though a bit primitive. Older travellers or those who cannot walk 2 flights of stairs should go elsewhere. Also, there is no one at the switchboard from about 8:30 PM to 8 AM local time. Service is extremely limited. Definitely not for business travellers either. I took a taxi at 6:30 AM to the airport from the hotel, and the driver had to walk upstairs to get my suitcase downstairs for me, as there is no one in attendance at that time. I would recommend it for younger travellers who seek an authentic 1920s Berlin atmosphere. The rate is reasonable and there is a good breakfast included in the price. Location is great.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Vanian
Reviews.Content: We loved this place, stayed for two nights as part of a European trip. We had the biggest hotel room we have ever stayed in, and it was decorated with great shabby chic style. There was no TV - but we didn't need it - we were just around the corner from Zoo Station and there was plenty to do nearby. The atmosphere in the hotel was excellent, as were the staff. The breakfast room was great.

Reviews.Title: “Well Managed; Pleasent”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Pension Funk was a great place to stay while visiting Berlin. For the price I paid, I received excellent service. Its proximity to the U-Bahn stop and Zoo Bhf makes it convenient. Its friendly staff made the stay pleasent. Breakfast good enough and the rooms were clean.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful boutique hotel”
Reviews.Author: MonicaSantaMonica
Reviews.Content: Very reasonably priced, small hotel right off of Ku-damn with very friendly, helpful staff and wonderful breakfast. Great location and very quiet. Former home of German silent film star.

HotelInfo.Name: Pension Funk
HotelInfo.Address: Fasanenstrasse 69, 10719 Berlin, Germany
